review: I've seen this place around for many years and no one ever talks about this place. I hear more about the commericals than the food. I ate here yesterday for lunch because I wanted a nasty burger. I ordered a cheeseburger and I have to say that it's not bad at all. They added relish to my burger and kind of threw the taste of the burger away. I don't think I'm going to have relish on my burgers anymore. The waitress hooked me up some extra fries to go, so that was boss. All in all...for the first time coming here...i was satisified.

Tonight we ordered the Southwest Chicken Salad and the Burning Love burger and both were delicious!  There's only one problem, I saw something that I wish I hadn't.  When I had to use the restroom in the middle of our meal I saw through the cracks of the stall that there was a person wearing the exact same orange-red shirt with dark gray black pants on; now while I was doing #1, he was finishing up #2.  The problem is not that I had to use that stall, it was the fact that when he was done, he had passed me and then the sink and exited the restroom.  Now, to be fair I can't say I saw a face; however given that the colors were the exact same as the other workers I'd say the probability that it was an employee is extremely high.  Luckily our food was served before he had to go to the restroom, so there was no risk of any tidbits from his wiping that would've ended up in our food. As for the later customers, well sucks for them. All in all, great food - but you run the risk of having extra flavors and textures in your food!

Red Robin has got to be one of the best burger joint's around. Well we got there right after they opened,no crowd which is rare being at the mall. We ordered our drinks and food. My wife got the roast beef sliders which came with fries and slaw. I got the prime rib burger which came with fries and dress the way it is on the menu. ( see pictures) Now the food was great and service was outstanding. This is my second vist to this location and on my next if it's just as good I see 5 stars.

Went here with a few friends for dinner (their choice). ATROCIOUSLY SLOW and disorganized service - we had 3 different waiters, we had to ASK for silverware (after our food came, and they walked away without realizing it), we had to ASK for drink refills, the food was very blah and not good (I ended up eating most of my daughters grilled cheese sandwich since my salad was an inedible lump of iceberg lettuce with a clump of chicken on top. Definitely won't return to this joint. I paid about 17 bucks with tax for a salad and a kid's grilled cheese and fruit cup and milk. Definitely not worth anywhere near that amount.

It was my birthday month (November) and Red Robin sent me a coupon for a free burger. I hadn't used it yet and my new beau was in town, visiting from Georgia and had never been to RR. He's a burger lover, so I told him we should check it out. On the way, we got into a car accident and were delayed quite a bit while we sorted all that out. I said we should skip RR, but he thought it'd be a good idea to drive over and just decompress from the craziness. We made our way over and I felt kind of bad because it was close to closing time. However, the wait staff took us with a smile and waited on us. They even made him a milkshake without an eye roll or a sigh. We got our burgers and they were both tasty. The waitress came back to check on us and gave us refills without complaint and we never felt rushed. She took the more expensive burger off the bill (really, less than a dollar difference, but it was a nice gesture) and I left her a good tip for putting us with us (I really feel terrible when I go in late to a restaurant, I know they want to go home ASAP). Good service, up to par with other Red Robins.

You know, I've come here ONLY because my car was being worked on at Sear's around the corner (for free, with my warranty) and I wanted to kill some time.  First time in, I tried their hummus platter, and was anything but pleased.  The ambiance was even worse.   This time around?  Exceptionally better.  I went with their turkey burger, and their bartender was actually -engaging- in conversation mid-day while I was the only patron there.  And I'll say, their turkey burger, for being a frozen patty, was not too damn shabby.  I'd never go out of my way to have drinks ... or even dinner here, but for a 'lighter' alternative to a burger, and something to kill time? (Read: Waiting for the significant others to get Xmas shopping done, or in my case, getting car work done) It works.

I didn't sit down and eat here I go it to go so this is mainly on the to go service.  My bf and I came here on his lunch break to grab it to go. If you want it to go you can call ahead or go in and order from the bar. When we placed our order it was a about a 10 min wait, which wasn't too bad for us since he works across the street. I got the soup and sandwich combo and same with my bf. However I got the BTLA with chowder and he got the whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap and chili. My sandwich was really good. The croissant was buttery, flakey and with the avocado turkey and bacon it was just delish. However I do wish my bacon was a little but more crispy cause it was just super flat looking, but still tasted good cause I mean come on it's bacon. Now my soup was a different story. Good, yes, but it had to be the strangest clam chowder I've ever had. I'm going in thinking I'm gonna get potatoes and celery. But all I got was clams. Literally just clams. I mean it was good but that's not clam chowder if you ask me. My bf really loved their chili though. He said it was just like a home style chili.  The bartender was really cool as we waited for our meals. He even refilled my freckled lemonade before I left.

The staff here are always nice and on this particular visit the food  came out extremely fast. It's been cooked consistently well, in my experience at this location. I guess it's  new pet peeve of mine that some restaurants have dumbed down ordering a hamburger by saying "pink or no pink." I get that makes it easier for them and it leaves open less room for people to say something was not cooked right... but it still feels like a bit of an insult that I don't know the difference between medium rare and medium well done.

These types of restaurants are generally only good for the consistency of the food, while the customer service is lacking. I've been to this particular location two or three times now. I'm always impressed with the food, and the service is usually quick. Not this time. Our server never actually helped us with anything. A manager came to take our drink order, and eventually brought us the drinks. The same manager took our food order. Another person delivered the food to the table, and when we were missing some things we had to ask another server. Eventually our actual server comes over to refill my drink, but of course she had no clue what I was drinking since she didn't take my order. I will say we got our order in a timely manner, thanks to the manager, and I wish my tip could've gone to him instead of the waitress.

If you have children who have food allergies, this is the perfect place to eat. Both of my children have allergies and Red Robin provides an iPad app that helps you choose items on their menu that will help you avoid any allergic reactions. As a mom of two who has been dealing with food allergies for almost seven years, Red Robin allowed me to breathe a sigh of relief while enjoying lunch with my family without any worry. Thank you!

Red Robin has reached the point where I will not be returning. We had been eating here often and will spend anywhere from $50 to $80 bucks per trip depending on the number of people but no more! The last straw was when I ordered a burger without pickles and then had  to debate with the server weather pickle relish was pickles.  then get the check and were over charged for other items.  At some point you have to just give up.  I'm there!

Food is always good for red robin standards, but the franchise isn't as good as it thinks it is. Great family place though. This restaurant can fill up and get loud quickly as it's small and has an open layout.

Had the Royal Red Robin Burger sharp cheddar, 8 oz burger with lettuce, tomato, mayo, pepper bacon and oh yes a sunny side up fried egg. Messy but absolutely an awesome burger with fresh hot steak fries.  Wife had haddock sandwich she said it was one of the best she's had.  We had some awesome cocktails (Patron Pear-Tini's and Berry Blood Orange Margaritas) at the bar.  The bartender was great with a great attitude as well as great service.  Overall I would have given them 5 star if the Red Velvet cake had been as good as everything else, it was dry.  This was the first time at this Red Robin it was easily these best one I have ever eaten at.  We will go back.  Quality was top notch except for the desert, the Service was an easy 5 stars.  Cleanliness was good and value wasn't and issue.

Food and environment. Is great walked in very busy however got sat immediately. Within 3 min had our server there taken our drink order. Im like wow and then within 4 more mins our food order was taken!!! Great experience great staff and good management. It was so good we had manager come over and speak to us he seems to be a great manager to work for we will be back. Thank you

Went with my daughter while out Christmas shopping.  We were promptly seated, drink order taken and food order taken.  Food came to us in a very reasonable amount of time.  I had the bacon cheeseburger it was very tasty, fresh and moist..  Child's dish was good as well according to my daughter. I ordered a beer. I had asked about drink specials and was told they don't have them.  Not even a happy hour? Not a fan of the "bottomless fries" concept.  The round tin they come in is small so your portion is way smaller than you receive in any sit down restaurant that offers a single serving of fries.  Was never offered more fries.  I shouldn't have to ask for more every time the waitress walks by and sees the little bottomless tin is empty.  Just give me a bigger serving to start with.

The restaurant maintained its flow all night. It was nice to enjoy a meal with ease, fast refills on drinks, wait staff setting there timing to a perfect pace between caring for their customers needs without harassing them mid bite.  The food was incredible, restrooms were spotless and the experience is all around pleasurable.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Service felt a bit rushed. I hadn't opened my menu before drink order, app request, and heavy sales pitch on bonus card was thrust upon me. Maybe lay off on the pressure to push these cards so quickly, management. My server seemed a little desperate for me to join. Ordered the onion rings which were super hot and tasty. Drinks came quickly and stayed refilled. My wife and I built our own burgers. My 10 yo daughter had the chicken strips. The food was really good, better than the Short Pump location. The food runner did not know which burger was mid-rare and which was medium. Told us medium was the as rare as they go which, from experience, I know is not true. My wife and I ended up with each other's order. No biggie really. I watched our server get 3 more tables, one a party of 8, within seconds of each other. Big props for him handling the crush. 4 stars on the food and server, maybe talk to the hostess about seating and handing out children's menus ( we didn't get one ) overall an enjoyable visit. Thanks yall.
Went to This Red Robin and it was bad, we sat down for 30 mins and no one came to our table.   We just left and we'll never going back to this place again.

I've been here a few times with just a friend and with a big group. Atmosphere is very lively. It's loud but in a fun way. The walls are covered wh interesting art that can take you a while to look at while waiting for food. Busy. Generally very busy but the wait time depends on how large your group is. You can call for reservations Customer service is ok. Sometimes they are chaotic and disorganized but that was rare. Some of the servers like to give a personal touch by being friendly and joking around. They care about kids.  Food is pretty good. I wouldn't call it the best but it was pretty good. If you like burgers this place is awesome.  Facilities um yucky. Well the first two times were not very well cleaned. Lonely had two stalls.  I would come again.

Typical Red Robin. Service was good, the food was decent. We had three different burgers at the table. All of them were made to order and tasted fine. Lunch crowd was pretty light. Like I said, typical RR.
Great salads  Great waitress Rude host  Service was a tad slow but food was good.  Strawberry lemonade excellent. Very decent restaurant.

I'm not sure if we'll go back.  Waitress (Lilly) seemed nice at first, and then was obviously rushed and became rude.  I couldn't even get her to bring me a straw! After multiple requests and her rudely saying 'she heard me, she was getting one right now,' I gave up and just didn't use one.  The restaurant was so crowded it was too loud to really carry on a conversation with anyone sitting at our own table.  The food was so so, standard bar burgers.  I was served something different from what I ordered.  The loyalty rewards program is a bit of a joke.  The lowest priced item was taken off a bill of four adults and three kids.  We earned that reward, have some class, people.  Not a great experience, all around.
You'd think the chicken I got tonight was tuna as pink as it was. Most disgusting food ever.  Literally throwing up.

We had an amazing server, it was busy but she did a good job. I don't remember her name but she had short dark hair and nicely drawn eyebrows. The salad was really bad and the spring mix was rotting so it tasted poor. The fries were ok and so were the burgers. My husband was happy with the food but I do t really like the restaurant but I was not impressed. Vegi burger was ok but all the extras I had to add made it not worth the price.  It's just not a very comfortable sitting area either, it's a very awkward restaurant and I try to avoid it at all costs.

I love Red Robin. I enjoy the burgers and fries. Each year, I enjoy going for my free birthday burger. Stopped in with the wife. Told the waiter it was my birthday :), gave him my card number and ordered a signature burger. Enjoyed eating our meal. Waiter comes at end stating my burger doesn't qualify for the free bday offer :(.   Why didn't he tell me that when I ordered?  Why didn't he ask the manager to make an exception? I was clear about telling him why I was there. It was my birthday. They had the opportunity to make my day but disappointed it.

The worst hamburger that I've had in a long time! Way over cooked and too dry to be used for a hockey puck. Paying was big problem, it was lunchtime and there credit card processor wasn't working. Too many other places to eat that are better!

Super busy night and decided to sit at the bar area. Our bartender Conrad was super awesome and attentive and provided excellent service. My husband and I really enjoyed ourselves and food was superb.
My burger was brought to me on a discussing dirty plate, ruined my appetite,  never will come here again.

I had the BIG TAVERN burger with double patty. My wife had the Mad Love Burger. Both sandwiches were on point! Our waitress was Mary and she had a really cute Rihanna style hair cut, she was also very knowledgeable about the burgers and very nice. You ever notice how RR burgers come out just like the pictures? Thats what I love about this burger spot, you get what you see.

Still a very good burger, w/ fries. Inconsistent service. Busy, not busy, I don't know. Attentive servers most of the time. Just touching base. If I'm in the area I usually drop in if I'm up for a cheeseburger. A short update.

I totally fell for the $15 commercial deal. Two double taverns burgers and either an appetizer or a dessert. I went with pretzels for an appetizer, which I recommend. I also had the Nacho Crunch Double Tavern burger. They were out of the nacho cheese, which was a bummer, but I was able to get some chipotle aioli in its place. My dining partner had the Pig Out. We were very hungry, so this deal was very satisfying, both for our taste buds, stomachs, and wallet. Luckily we didn't have to wait at all to be seated, order and eat. Great weekday dinner.

Okay so i know its a chain place that focuses on burgers and i should probably lower my expectations but today was nearly a total miss for lunch. Hubby got a side salad, burger and fries. Only complaint was that the bacon on the burger was no where near crispy. My meal was way off. I ordered a side ceasar salad and a bowl of french onion soup. The bowl of soup was under 8 oz. I thought it woild be bigger for 4.59. I had to ask for the garlic bread that the menu stated comes with it, and after asking i got 1 piece that was half the size of a regular sandwich bread slice. Side ceasar salad had no croutons, a sprinkle of cheese, and no dressing upon arrival. The waitress returned it ans brought it back with dressing on it. What little there was was as expected for a burger place, tasted average.  My husband and i had to share one fork between us for the meal, since we both had salads that was fun. My bet is that the nearby mall food court would leave you, your tummy, and wallet happier.
If you just want some good simple burgers and fries, you can never go wrong with Red Robins!

Very disappointed.  My hamburger came out cold.  The "crispy peppers" were soggy and cold.  The service was poor.  Long wait - they should have at least brought us fries during the wait but nothing.   I can't recommend this Red Robin.  There is better burgers out there, especially when you consider the price paid for Red Robin.

Once again I have found great service but food was only marginal. French fries were barely warm.  We are in the middle of the afternoon so maybe that is why, they weren't fresh. Overall experience was just okay.

Crowded as usual. The concept of family dinning has changed for the worse. The chairs are super tight. Families are cramped in smaller tables. Nothing really enjoyable. Most of the food is fried but hey, some people like that.

Wow! Time and time again the service is so slow.  It was so bad today the manager offered my daughter a free milkshake but we have been waiting for it for 20 minutes.  Too bad, good food but takes way too long.

Whisky bbq wrap - you have to do it! It was seriously so yummy. My favorite is the freckled lemodnade and if you keep it coming in happy. They have the best sweet potatoe fries around !! Today's experience was a 5 star. Good job guys! Can't wait to come back.

They really need some kind of call ahead seating for their location.  I actually called to ask if they had a wait.  The lady said no (I was a little concerned because she didn't ask many any other questions and seemed kind of clueless as to the question). We were in the mall parking lot so walked in 4 minutes later and there is 15 minute wait they say now.  Either train your people to answer the phone properly or get a real system for people to come to your restaurant without having to wait.  We had to leave and go to another restaurant as the reason I called to ask was we didn't have time to wait.  Very disappointed in this locations policies toward customers (and we walk out of here more than not because of he wait).  I will continue to infrequent this location although I do like the Red Robin chain.

Superb service when eating at the restaurant! Quick refills on drinks and fries! The food was delicious and served hot and fresh. Take out- ordered the asap time which says 14 minutes.. Waited about 40. Portion sizes on sides were tiny and food was almost warm when it got home ( live less than 5 minutes away)

If you are looking for a decent burger look harder. The kitchen here is most likely lacking some formal education as it appears they cannot read basic instructions. Hopefully you aren't picky nor need special accommodations for your order, if so it will be completely disregarded and you will get just what the menu says. Also don't bother complaining as it will most likely take just as long for them to fix your order as it did for the initial item to come out, in this instance 30-45 min for two burgers. On another note make sure not to dress up as you will surely be using your garments as napkins.
One of my favorite spots to eat. I Have to try a burger next time. I tend to order the  fish & Chips almost every time.

Standard Red Robin! Food was great. I am always a fan of Red Robin. I was happy to see a location near where we were staying. We don't have them in Charleston! The location is inside the mall, with a small side entrance from the outside.  The service... Meh. They've switched over to using the touch pads for things. We rarely interacted with our waiter besides drinks/checking in once on us.  The restaurant was clean, as well as the bathrooms. Always a good thing!

When I came a there was no host so I sat at the bar but the bartender was courteous and she took my order in a very timely manner/ I ordered the fish and chips which took a long time to cook which is strange because there is hardly anyone in the restaurant they still have not approved food prep time but at least the waitstaff it's a lot better

I used to eat here every once in a while, the food was decent.  After my last visit there was a fly in my salad. I asked for the manager and he said "these things happen" and asked would I like another side. I will not be returning.
Worst service ive had in a long time. Wouldnt come back if it was free. If its gonna be 50 min to be seated you should tell people that and not 20 minutes

A very good burger joint with quality food and a decent draft beer selection.  One of the nice things is they offer bottomless steak fries with a burger, which is a nice perk at any restaurant, but especially here where the steak fries are great.  Another nice thing is there campfire sauce which is great for dipping your fries or onion rings, which are also excellent.  Our table was a group of 5 and every one loved what they got. I think they're among the better national chains that I've been to and I I'll be back.
Love their steak fries with sweet Thai chili sauce. Although the Waiting line took too long: 3 stars, the manager deserves 5 stars!

I love the burgers this place offers. They're big, juicy and packed with flavor. Some of my favorites are the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, Bleu Ribbon, and the Royal Red Robin. The appetizers aren't bad either. The Pretzel Bites, Fresh-Fried Zucchini Sticks, and Jalapeño Coins are the perfect start to your meal. With the great selections, this place has to offer you're not going to leave hungry.

This was my first experience at a red robin and it was great! We were starving and the food was both delicious and satisfying. There were options to make the meal healthier such as lettuce instead of bread for the sandwiches. Customer service was average to above average. Good experience.

It is what it is...& I think it's great!  Yes...it's your typical burger/fries/family oriented chain...but don't you just want that sometimes?  My favorite is their Tavern Double (a "fancy" play on a Big Mac...but much...MUCH better) & of course their bottomless STEAK (yes...it really DOES make a difference!!!) fries.  The servers are helpful (Shout out to Clayton...who was SO awesome the other night...even though we may have been a bit P.I.T.A.-ish...;)), the burgers always juicy & the fries hot & fresh!  Join their "Red Royalty" club.  You'll receive TONS of perks...like (as of this review...) a free burger on your birthday/a "buy nine items, get the tenth free" online punch card/special emailed promos/etc.

awesome server,  erin , professional and personal and attentive great asset to your staff. food was wonderful,  received my free birthday burger prepared medium rare just the way i like my burger and dinner mate ordered awesome turkey burger . great birthday celebration.

The food is never disappointing!  I ordered the black and bleu burger, added avocado and blam!  This combination was to die for!  Our server was not the best, hence the one star missing.  All you can eat steak fries, but we did not get any after requesting twice.  We asked for more broccoli for my sons meal and that did not come either.  Food was great, just wish we had more, as promised.  Service, host was great, server not so great.

At this location I have been twice. Both times service was poor. Younger workers that seem to have no customer service training. Be prepared to wait longer than normal from walking  in the door to getting your bill.

Red Robin has always been a solid choice for me when it comes to feeding my burger crave. Prices aren't what I'd call cheap, service times largely depends on what day and time you come, but I think the quality of the foods makes up for it in the end. Red Robin has a large selection of burgers that you wouldn't get elsewhere. Their burgers are presented clean and neat. Not trash like a fast food restaurant, and not messy like a hipster "hole in the wall" burger joint. My choice of burger each time is the Fiery Ghost Style Tavern Double Burger. It always tastes great and coupled with bottomless fries, makes a pretty good choice. I rarely go past 2 buckets of fries. I'd say the fries are okay. They come out hot and cooked, but they seem to lack some flavor and crunchiness compared to what fries are known for.  Service for the most part, has been quite busy for me. It's usually they're really packed and so the waiters/waitresses are frantically trying to serve them all and find seating for me and my group. I can't fault them for that as they're just doing their job and business is busy, but just a fair heads up. There are times and days where it's slower, so try to go on those times/days (usually non-typical eating out days/times). Some locations will have a self check out with a tablet too, which is super convenient and cool. Overall, if you want a step above fast food, but not crazy expensive hipster burger joint, Red Robin is a great choice in my eyes. I know some people don't come here because of pricing or busy place, well, what do you expect? This is what happens when you come to a popular place! It's definitely a nice place to eat out for celebrations or once in a while.

My wife and I stopped here with some friends of ours for dinner. We waited 13 minutes to be seated, even though there were plenty of empty seats. When we did get seated, our server entertained us with how his week went, how boring it had been and how happy that he was excited to see us. I wouldn't have mind if it was a minute or two, but he went on for approximately 15 minutes before taking our order, he went on so long that it gave everyone at the table to figure out what they wanted to eat and drink. My wife ordered the fish and chip platter, I ordered the turkey burger with the tower of onion rings. Our friends ordered a chicken salad with fries and the burger and bottomless fries. When we received our drinks, I had to sit through another session concerning my unsweetened ice tea and how others are confused by the listed tea orders. When our food arrived, my order came with a regular order of onion rings. After a few minutes, I saw another server and informed him that I was supposed to receive the tower of onion rings but I received a side order. When my original server came back, he did apologize in a very rambling way and told me that my onion rings would be forthcoming. After 30 more minutes, we were finished and ready for the check. My burger was extremely flat and was with out the tomatoes and cheese that was suppose to be on it. My wife's order was dry or over cooked. Our friends orders were alright. Overall, we could have eaten and been out if our server would have cut down on the conversation about himself and focused more on customer service. I learned never to trust someone that does not write your orders down. My food order would have been right if he would have done so! Go if you have plenty of time on your hands!
